result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Watson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Watson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Anthony Watson.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 13 pages) commencing 09-09-2022 by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Anthony Watson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Anthony Watson.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Hales Corners Officer N.Boneck. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Watson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Sargent has intake and is unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent

Defendant Anthony Watson not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with W. Schmid and the 5200 block of S 68th St
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.No driving without a valid license.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Watson
Current: 1438 S 31st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 07-08-2022)
Prior: 3257 North 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Anthony Watson in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Anthony Watson in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
